data.title: 882. 47 ‚ÄúFunny‚Äù Country Jokes, Explained
data.text:
882. 47 ‚ÄúFunny‚Äù Country Jokes, Explained | Learn English with Humour

Here‚Äôs a list of jokes about different countries which I found on the website Bored Panda. I‚Äôll tell you the jokes and then explain them all (dissecting the frog), including any homophones, double meanings or specific cultural references. Can you ‚Äúget‚Äù the jokes? Do you find any of them funny, or are they all just terrible dad jokes? And, what vocabulary can you learn in the process? Includes a vocabulary review at the end of the episode.

[DOWNLOAD AUDIO]

Notes

In this episode we‚Äôre going to read some jokes about different countries in the world, and I‚Äôm going to use them to help you learn English.

They‚Äôre not really jokes about countries. They‚Äôre mainly just jokes based on the country names. So I won‚Äôt be making fun of specific countries or anything.

I‚Äôve found a list of 100 jokes.

Jokes like these‚Ä¶

üëç

#12

Which country‚Äôs capital city is growing the fastest?

Ireland.

Because every day it‚Äôs Dublin.

doubling??

Some of these jokes are very stupid.

Some of them are terrible.

But some of them are actually pretty funny üòÖ

This is all just a bit of fun, but also it‚Äôs a chance to learn some vocabulary.

Before we continue, I need to make several jokes about my country: The UK

A map of the UK

It‚Äôs just there, under that huge rain storm.

More specifically, England

Football

What do you call an English man in the World Cup final?

The referee.

British Food

Well, this is how our biscuits are sold in France

C‚Äôest Anglais, mais c‚Äôest bon !

Translation:

It‚Äôs English, but it‚Äôs good.

*Actually they‚Äôre Scottish

*Actually the company is owned by a Turkish confectionery conglomerate

And I‚Äôm sure you could write plenty of jokes about our Royal Family‚Ä¶

But you don‚Äôt really need to

Subtext: They‚Äôre already quite funny aren‚Äôt they?

I don‚Äôt mean to be rude about our king, but apparently he has a sense of humour, so I‚Äôm sure he doesn‚Äôt mind.

cheers

Can you understand these jokes?

If you understand a joke you can say

‚ÄúI get it‚Äù

If you don‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs supposed to be funny, you‚Äôd say

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt get it‚Äù

If you understand it, but you think it isn‚Äôt funny, you can just groan.

ü§¶

There will be VOCABULARY

I will explain every joke that you hear in this episode, including

any double meanings

any homophones (words which sound the same but which are different)

or any other little cultural details

I have only had

a very quick look

at this list of jokes.

I found this joke list on the website BoredPanda.com. There are 100 jokes in the list, but I‚Äôve only seen about the first 15 jokes.

I haven‚Äôt seen the rest.

So I am going to be reading most of these for the first time, so let‚Äôs discover these jokes together.

Disclaimer:

This might not be funny

at all üòê

It‚Äôs necessary to say this again‚Ä¶

I will dissect these jokes. You might learn some English,

but the jokes will probably die in the process.

Sorry jokes, and sorry frogs.

üê∏

But don‚Äôt worry. No actual frogs will be harmed during the making of this episode.

And when I say ‚Äúfrogs‚Äù I‚Äôm not talking about French people üá´üá∑

‚ÄúDissecting the frog‚Äù or explaining jokes is something I‚Äôve been doing on this podcast for years.

by a listener called Evgenia

a T-shirt design by a listener called Adel (available in my merch store

‚Äì the t-shirt I mean)

www.teacherluke.co.uk/merch

Click here to see this design in my merch store.

Let‚Äôs keep reading jokes until nobody can take it any more.

I‚Äôll tell about 5 jokes, then I‚Äôll explain them, and then I‚Äôll continue with more jokes‚Ä¶

Click here for the joke listüëáüëáüëáüëáüëá

100 Country Jokes To Kindle Your Wanderlust | Bored Panda

The Jokes (it‚Äôs a mixed bag)

England doesn‚Äôt have a kidney bank, but it does have a Liverpool.

A slice of apple pie is $2.50 in Jamaica and $3.00 in the Bahamas.

These are the pie rates of the Caribbean.

A British man is visiting Australia. The customs agent asks him, ‚ÄúDo you have a criminal record?‚Äù The British man replies, ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt think you needed one to get into Australia anymore.‚Äù

One day Canada will rule the world‚Ä¶

Then you‚Äôll all be sorry.

What‚Äôs the best thing about Switzerland?

I don‚Äôt know, but the flag is a big plus.

Why do the French eat snails?

They don‚Äôt like fast food.

Amsterdam is a lot like the Tour de France. Just a lot of people on drugs riding bikes.

I asked my friend in North Korea how he was.

He said he can‚Äôt complain.

Germany and France go to war. Who loses?

Belgium.

What do you call a vegan Viking?

A Norvegan!

How do you get a Canadian to apologize?

Step on their foot.

Which country‚Äôs capital is growing the fastest?

Ireland. Every day it‚Äôs Dublin.

What does the Loch Ness monster eat?

Fish and ships.

Want to hear a Swedish joke?

Never mind. There‚Äôs Norway I could Finnish it.

What do frogs eat in Paris?

French flies.

An Englishman, a Scotsman and an Irishman enter a bar.

The Englishmen wanted to go, so they all had to leave.

What do you call a bee that lives in America?

A USB.

Why haven‚Äôt Americans changed their weighing method from pounds to kilograms?

Because they don‚Äôt want mass confusion!

How does every Russian joke start?

By looking over your shoulder.

I have a Russian friend who‚Äôs a sound technician.

And a Czech one too. A Czech one too.

What kind of birds can you find in Portugal?

Portugeese.

What was the most popular kids‚Äô movie in Ancient Greece?

Troy Story.

What is the most common scam in Egypt?

Pyramid schemes.

What happened to the American who went to the hospital with a broken leg?

He went broke.

In which country is Prague located?

Hold on let me Czech.

Is ‚ÄúAfrica‚Äù by Toto a country song?

No, it‚Äôs a continent song.

What did the Kiwi say to the Rabbi?

Hee Broo.

Did you hear about the Italian chef that died?

He pasta way.

Germany once organized the International Fun Conference.

It wasn‚Äôt funny but it was indeed well organized.

Two very old men of European nationality meet

While talking, one asks: ‚ÄúYou watching the football game?‚Äù

The other says: ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs playing?‚Äù

‚ÄúAustria-Hungary‚Äù, says the first.

‚ÄúAgainst whom?‚Äù

An introverted Finn looks at his shoes when talking to you; an extroverted Finn looks at your shoes.

Why do bagpipe players walk while they play?

To get away from the noise.

Why do all Swedish military ships have bar codes on them?

So when the come to port, they can just Scan da navy in!

How was copper wire invented?

Two Scotsmen fighting over a penny.

What are Greek houses made out of?

Greeks and con-Crete!

Why is it hard to make friends in Antarctica?

Because you can‚Äôt break the ice.

What pan is the best to make sushi in?

Japan.

What will an Australian chess player say to a Czech person while making the winning move?

Czech mate.

A friend in Germany tells me everyone‚Äôs panic buying sausages and cheese.

It‚Äôs the Wurst K√§se scenario.

What do you call a bunch of bullies from Malta?

Maltesers.

Ever since my girlfriend moved to Siberia things haven‚Äôt been the same.

She‚Äôs so cold and distant.

The Sahara Desert drifts into a bar and the bartender says‚Ä¶

‚ÄúLong time no sea.‚Äù

Did you hear about the Pole who thought his wife was trying to kill him? On her dressing table, he found a bottle of ‚ÄúPolish Remover.‚Äù

I‚Äôve heard that Argentina is starting to get a little colder‚Ä¶

In fact, it‚Äôs bordering on Chile.

What‚Äôs Santa‚Äôs nationality?

North Polish.

What genre are national anthems?

Country.

Did you hear McDonalds will stop serving fries in Switzerland?

The Swiss don‚Äôt take sides.

Vocabulary List (listen to the episode for my explanations)

A kidney bank

Liver

A criminal record

A (big) plus

Snails

I can‚Äôt complain

To double in size

The Loch Ness monster

Bees, flies

Mass confusion

‚ÄúCheck one two, check one two‚Äù

One goose, two geese

A scam

A pyramid scheme

To go broke

To pass away

Barcodes

A pan

A worst-case scenario

To bully/tease someone

To be cold and distant

Nail polish remover

It‚Äôs bordering on chilly

A side of french fries
